channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street cleaning / refuse collection / fly tipping, 2nd November
item.description:
Please fix refuse and domestic waste collection on Charles Grinling Walk, which looks like a dump again. 1. The double mattress pictured has been here two weeks, since 19 October. Please consider creating a bulky waste collection area as on other estates with high tenant turnover. 2. Council workers taped off the central recycling bin on Monday. It’s now overflowing, creating needless work for street cleaners. Please move an additional palladin bin to this location as previously suggested and/or replace recycling bins with regular waste bins. 3. Please collect bagged leaves left by RBG staff. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charles Grinling Walk, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Items left out on pavement, 2nd November
item.description:
From outside 85 Chadwick down to outside the flats on the corner, various items left out on pavement. Old cabinets. Parts of a table. Packages. Please clear. Also, pavement is constantly obstructed by wheelie bins: please encourage residents to find space on their own properties for these.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Chadwick Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Line bike causing anti-social behavior and nuisance to members are public and residents on a daily basis after moving these bikes out the way or off of people's cars. Hackney Council only care about investment and money that they are receiving from line bikes. Line bikes are a inconvenience for many people causing upset and obstructions in the areaYes, Hackney Council receives funds from a new agreement with e-bike operators Lime and Voi, from which it will receive a cut of the income. The council also partners with other organizations and initiatives to provide and fund various hire schemes, such as the "Cargo Bike Share" scheme, which is part of a wider network of shared bikes, and has secured funding through grants from the government for a "Cycle Loan" program for its employees. ., 2nd November
item.description:
Lime bikes causing nuisance and antisocial behavior. Council do not care about the anti-social behavior or nuisance these bikes are causing to people's routines. Long is hackney council pockets online with investment and money.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Semley Gate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole outside 132 Belmont road in middle of road, 2nd November
item.description:
There is a large pothole in the middle of the road that has been infilled on number of occasions as previously reported but the repair has always been inadequate and the hole appears to be getting longer due to the heavy traffic continuously going over it and damaging further. The road has been resurfaced at both ends but the middle section could do with being resurfaced
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over hanging the, 2nd November
item.description:
This tree/trees are overhanging and is tied with a blue rope to hold it back, the dropped leaves block the drain which causes a massive puddle when it rains we lose maybe 3 cars parking spaces also the birds in the drop poop down on to all the cars it’s a mess please help thank you
